title: How to Make Gourmet Nachos

steps.headline: Place diced tomatoes in a medium saucepan on medium heat.
steps.description: Be sure to include the tomatoes’ own juices.

steps.headline: Stir refried beans into warmed tomatoes.
steps.description: Continue heating and mixing until well combined.

steps.headline: Add rinsed beans and lime juice to saucepan and stir well.
steps.description: Taste the mix and add salt if necessary. Turn the burner to low and allow to sit for the time being.

steps.headline: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F / 175 degrees C.
In a second medium saucepan, brown ground beef on medium.
steps.description: Strain rendered fat into an empty bean can and throw away once cool and solidified.

steps.headline: Once beef is browned, add diced onion.
Add diced jalapenos and salt to taste.
steps.description: If using canned jalapenos, add juice as well. Turn off burner.

steps.headline: Pour beef mixture into a large casserole dish.
steps.description: Don’t worry about spraying or greasing the dish beforehand.

steps.headline: Pour bean mixture over the beef mixture.
steps.description: If it doesn’t all fit, set the excess aside. Be sure to turn off the burner the beans were on.

steps.headline: Cover the bean layer with cheese and garnish with olives and cilantro.
Bake nacho mixture until cheese is melted or slightly browned.
steps.description: Turn off oven and serve alongside a communal bowl of tortilla chips as well as guacamole and sour cream (optional). Allow each person to scoop their own serving of nacho toppings to keep the mixture hot and the chips crispy.

steps.headline: Spread tortilla chips out on a baking pan.
steps.description: Line the pan with tinfoil for easy cleanup. Make sure that flat side of each chip is visible. Overlap the chips slightly so that you can't see much of the pan.

steps.headline: Sprinkle cheese on top of chips.
steps.description: Cover chips generously or they will burn.

steps.headline: Sprinkle chips with black beans (optional).
steps.description: This will make it heartier and more filling.

steps.headline: Top chips with green pepper, jalapenos, and olives.
Place pan into oven and close the door most of the way.
steps.description: The nachos will cook extremely quickly, so you need to watch closely to make sure they don’t burn.

steps.headline: Remove nachos when cheese is melted and the edges of the chips are faintly brown.
steps.description: Serve with cool sour cream and guacamole if desired.

text: Nachos with Ground Beef Place diced tomatoes in a medium saucepan on medium heat. Be sure to include the tomatoes’ own juices. Stir refried beans into warmed tomatoes. Continue heating and mixing until well combined. Add rinsed beans and lime juice to saucepan and stir well. Taste the mix and add salt if necessary. Turn the burner to low and allow to sit for the time being. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F / 175 degrees C.  In a second medium saucepan, brown ground beef on medium. Strain rendered fat into an empty bean can and throw away once cool and solidified. Once beef is browned, add diced onion. Cook onion until translucent. Add diced jalapenos and salt to taste. If using canned jalapenos, add juice as well. Turn off burner. Pour beef mixture into a large casserole dish. Don’t worry about spraying or greasing the dish beforehand. Pour bean mixture over the beef mixture. If it doesn’t all fit, set the excess aside. Be sure to turn off the burner the beans were on. Cover the bean layer with cheese and garnish with olives and cilantro.  Bake nacho mixture until cheese is melted or slightly browned. Turn off oven and serve alongside a communal bowl of tortilla chips as well as guacamole and sour cream (optional). Allow each person to scoop their own serving of nacho toppings to keep the mixture hot and the chips crispy. Finished.  Vegetarian Nachos Preheat oven to 350 F.  Spread tortilla chips out on a baking pan. Line the pan with tinfoil for easy cleanup. Make sure that flat side of each chip is visible. Overlap the chips slightly so that you can't see much of the pan. Sprinkle cheese on top of chips. Cover chips generously or they will burn. Sprinkle chips with black beans (optional). This will make it heartier and more filling. Top chips with green pepper, jalapenos, and olives. Add cilantro if desired. Place pan into oven and close the door most of the way. The nachos will cook extremely quickly, so you need to watch closely to make sure they don’t burn. Remove nachos when cheese is melted and the edges of the chips are faintly brown. Serve with cool sour cream and guacamole if desired.
